intro: Ptychopyxis grandis, commonly known as the large-leafed mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant that grows on the branches of host trees. Ptychopyxis grandis is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, where it plays a role in ecological interactions and seed dispersal.
